Title: "Virus" by Tom Clancy & Steve Pieczenik (with W. Michael Gear)

"Virus" is a techno-thriller novel that was published in 1994 under the writing duo of Tom Clancy and Steve Pieczenik (alongside W. Michael Gear), and it certainly fits your criteria. The story revolves around a computer virus that threatens to disrupt a U.S. missile defense system, and one of the main characters, with a significant role, is Sam Francis.

Sam Francis is an Assistant Secretary for Politcal Military Affairs working for the U.S. government, and he becomes embroiled in the investigation to find the creator of this destructive computer virus and prevent a strategic calamity. Along the way, he collaborates with Jack Ryan (a protagonist from other Tom Clancy novels) to decipher the coded message responsible for unleashing the virus.

Although Sam is not the central protagonist of the book, his character plays a crucial part in unraveling the intricate plot and tackling the digital threat. For an edge-of-your-seat, suspenseful read that dives into the world of computer viruses, "Virus" by Tom Clancy & Steve Pieczenik is an excellent choice.
